publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-929 Alex Neil: State of the Farming Industry—That the Parliament notes the desperate situation in which Scotland’s farming community finds itself and in particular draws attention to the special plight of dairy farming, particularly in Ayrshire; calls upon the Scottish Executive to take urgent action to tackle the situation, and demands that the UK Government and the European Commission pursue policies designed to bring about a recovery in these industries.
S1M-929 State of the Farming Industry (lodged on 31 May 2000) Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-929 Alex Neil: State of the Farming Industry-That the Parliament notes the desperate situation in which Scotland's farming community finds itself and in particular draws attention to the special plight of dairy farming, particularly in Ayrshire; calls upon the Scottish Executive to take urgent action to tackle the situation, and demands that the UK Government and the European Commission pursue policies designed to bring about a recovery in these industries. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan
S1M-929 State of the Farming Industry (lodged on 31 May 2000) Christine Grahame*, Colin Campbell*
S1M-929 State of the Farming Industry (lodged on 31 May 2000) Dr Winnie Ewing*

S1M-929 Alex Neil: State of the Farming Industry-That the Parliament notes the desperate situation in which Scotland's farming community finds itself and in particular draws attention to the special plight of dairy farming, particularly in Ayrshire; calls upon the Scottish Executive to take urgent action to tackle the situation, and demands that the UK Government and the European Commission pursue policies designed to bring about a recovery in these industries. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Christine Grahame, Colin Campbell, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr Andrew Welsh*
S1M-929 State of the Farming Industry (lodged on 31 May 2000) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-929 State of the Farming Industry (lodged on 31 May 2000) Michael Russell*

S1M-929 Alex Neil: State of the Farming Industry—That the Parliament notes the desperate situation in which Scotland’s farming community finds itself and in particular draws attention to the special plight of dairy farming, particularly in Ayrshire; calls upon the Scottish Executive to take urgent action to tackle the situation, and demands that the UK Government and the European Commission pursue policies designed to bring about a recovery in these industries. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Christine Grahame, Colin Campbell, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr Andrew Welsh, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Michael Russell

Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Christine Grahame, Colin Campbell, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr Andrew Welsh, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Michael Russell, Mr Adam Ingram, Tricia Marwick, Mr Gil Paterson

S1M-929 Alex Neil: State of the Farming Industry—That the Parliament notes the desperate situation in which Scotland’s farming community finds itself and in particular draws attention to the special plight of dairy farming, particularly in Ayrshire; calls upon the Scottish Executive to take urgent action to tackle the situation, and demands that the UK Government and the European Commission pursue policies designed to bring about a recovery in these industries.
